name: Sock Club 2014
description:
If you are reading this, then you are considering joining us on our first sock club journey :)

My Awesome Indie designer friend Fiona and I have got together to offer you our Fiona Hamilton-MacLaren Designs~Babylonglegs Sock Club for 2014.

You will get 6 skeins of sock yarn (various bases of my choosing), 6 Sock Patterns and 6 stitch markers over a 12 month period, and it will cost you £100.

If you break it down, you’ll be getting 6 skeins of yarn for £10.50, 6 patterns for £15 and 6 markers for £1 !! (the remainder of the cost is UK and European P&P)

For my overseas customers, I have added the extra P&P costs for you to be charged at checkout :)

The patterns will be delivered digitally, and the yarn & stitch marker will come to you through the post at the beginning~middle of every other month, currently planned to commence in January 2014 :) If I feel people need more time to think, as Christmas is a very expensive time for everyone, I may move it to February and extend the sign-up time till the end of January, as opposed to the beginning ... if this happens, I will let all existing signed up members know straight away via e-mail.

You will be kept fully in the loop about all news and updates via email, (so please make sure you give me an email you use regularly) and I'll also be posting on my Ravelry Group where Fiona can also be found to offer as much pattern support as you may need

Are you ready?

Then Lets Get This Party Started!!

categories.name: S O C K C L U B

name: Kettle~Dyed Greens, MesMerino, 460g
description:
Kettle~dyed in my home studio, with acid dyes. This isn't a very precise method of dyeing, so the colour repeats will almost probably not match up exactly! It has ties in 4 places, so should be super easy to wind into a ball :)

This is a lovely, soft and bouncy DK weight yarn, and with 460g, there's more than enough for a childs garment, or even a smaller adults garment :) Would also be enough for a crocheted/knitted balnket, the possibilities are endless.

230yds/ 210m per 115g skein

100% 18 micron SW Merino

Suggested Needle size: 3.5~4.5mm

**Superwash, but I'd recommend handwashing and blocking flat, especially after all that time you spent knitting with it!!!**

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

Thanks for looking, and Happy Shopping!!!!

***Overseas Customers***

I have added what I *think* the postage will come to. If it is too much, I will refund you the difference, if it isn't enough, you have got a bargain ;)

name: Cortezs' Gold, Perfection
description:
Dip~dyed by me, in my Studio, using acid dyes :)

'Perfection' is made up of six plies (or 'ends' as they are correctly known in spinner lingo), quite loosely plied... 420m of pure and unadulterated LuXuRY . Because it is 'multi~ended, it will also have fantastic stitch definition. I advise you work with a blunt~ish needle, as it would be a shame to split the yarn as you knit/crochet.

Absoloutely perfect for Shawls/Shawlettes and even Hats, as it will drape beautifully, but definitely not for socks!! It's pure mulberry silk, so quite unsuitable for the footwear department!

100%Pure Mulberry Silk

**Handwash Only!!**

460 yards/420 m, per 100g skein

Suggested Needle size =3 ~4 mm

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

Thanks for looking, and Happy Shopping!!!!

***Overseas Customers***

I have added what I *think* the postage will come to. If it is too much, I will refund you the difference, if it isn't enough, you have got a bargain ;)

name: The Perfect Green, semi~Precious
description:
This is an amazing, shiny base yarn, takes the dye really intensely, and because of the silk content, will drape beautifully.

Perfect for a slouchy hat, or with a few more skeins, something big and luxurious! 200g of this would also make a beautiful shawl :D

This is a high quality superwash merino~silk sock weight yarn, dip~dyed in my studio to achieve a almost solid/semi-solid effect.

You won't EVER want to stop touching it, it is so silky and soft, and the sheen on it truly is stunning :D

50% SW Merino Wool ~ 50% Silk

437 yds/ 400m per 100g (enough for a pair of adult socks)

Suggested needle size: 2-3mm

Machine washable (but I'd recommend hand washing to preserve the vibrancy of the colours)

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

Thanks for looking, and Happy Shopping!!!!

name: Pie, Radiance Sock
description:
Dip~dyed by me, in my Studio, using acid dyes :)

A tweedy 3 ply Sock Yarn, Radiance's little sister, and is a very special yarn because of the fantastic way it plays with colours.

Perfectly delicate enough for Shawls/Shawlettes and even Hats, definitely not for socks!! It's pure wool, so quite unsuitable for the footwear department :P

To see a project made from this yarn, please visit My Blog

100% Merino Wool

**Handwash Only!!**

440 yards/400 m, per 100g skein

Suggested Needle size =3.25-4mm

name: RosenRot, LoveLace
description:
Dip~dyed by me, in my Studio, using acid dyes :)

'Lovelace' is made up of two plies, it's bouncy and shiny and yummy!

600 m per skein, so not quite sock yarn and not quite Lace... so, if lace scares you a little, because it's so thin, this is perfect for the transition from sock to lace. Tied in 3 places around the skein, so it should be fairly easy to wind as well :)

Absolutely perfect for Shawls, in fact all Lace projects, and not at all scary :-)

55% BFL~45% Silk

656 yds /600 m, per 100g skein

Suggested Needle size: varies according to effect wanted

**Superwash, but I'd recommend handwashing and blocking flat, especially after all that time you spent knitting with it!!!**

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

Thanks for looking, and Happy Shopping!!!!

name: Raven, Perfection Sock
description:
Dip~dyed by me, in my Studio, using acid dyes :)

'Perfection' is made up of six plies (or 'ends' as they are correctly known in spinner lingo), quite loosely plied... 420m of pure and unadulterated LuXuRY . Because it is 'multi~ended, it will also have fantastic stitch definition. I advise you work with a blunt~ish needle, as it would be a shame to split the yarn as you knit/crochet.

Absoloutely perfect for Shawls/Shawlettes and even Hats, as it will drape beautifully, but definitely not for socks!! It's pure mulberry silk, so quite unsuitable for the footwear department!

100%Pure Mulberry Silk

**Handwash Only!!**

460 yards/420 m, per 100g skein

Suggested Needle size =3 ~4 mm

description:
Introducing semi~Precious Aran... the newest addition to my semi~Precious Family!

It's a gorgeously soft and sleek yarn, not very tightly spun so you can really delight in it's construction... and it takes colour wonderfully, just like it's siblings

Perfect for a hat, mittens, or with a few more skeins a luxurious scarf

This is a high quality superwash merino~silk DK yarn, dip~dyed in my studio to achieve a semi-solid effect.

You won't EVER want to stop touching it, it is so silky and soft, and the sheen on it truly is stunning :D

50% SW Merino Wool ~ 50% Silk

182 yds/166 m, per 100g skein

name: 'Tangled River' and Custom~Dyed semi~Precious DK
description:
My good friend WoollyWormhead designed this beautiful hat out of this particular yarn, and it was featured some months ago on the cover of 'Knit Now' magazine.

Woolly lives on an artists commune in Italy, and they are currently experiencing quite a few legal difficulties, so she is giving the proceeds of the sales of this particular pattern to help them overcome these. Please go and read her Blog HERE here, as it explains it so much better than I can :P

Sofar, as the 'Save Mutonia' campaign approaches the 48hr mark, the fundraising effort has reached £715! So, to help them reach £1K, I have decided to offer this custom-dyed Yarn and Pattern kit

If you buy the yarn and pattern kit from me, 100% of the pattern proceeds will go to help the cause (so £3) and I'll also donate £2 of the yarn proceeds as well. I'll send the yarn to you in the post, and email you the PDF. Or alternatively, you can request a paper copy, but you won't get the PDF as well.

Or, you can just donate a few pounds to help, the donate button is at the bottom of Woolly's blog post ... anything you can do to help would be much appreciated, to help keep this artistic community alive!

This is an amazing, shiny base yarn, takes the dye really intensely, and because of the silk content, will drape beautifully.

Perfect for a slouchy hat, such as 'Tangled River' or with a few more skeins, something big and luxurious! 200g of this would make a beautiful shawl :D

This is a high quality superwash merino~silk DK yarn, dip~dyed in my studio to achieve a semi-solid effect.

You won't EVER want to stop touching it, it is so silky and soft, and the sheen on it truly is stunning :D

50% SW Merino Wool ~ 50% Silk

230yds/ 212m per 100g p>

Suggested needle size: 4-4.5mm

Machine washable (but I'd recommend hand washing to preserve the vibrancy of the colours)

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

Thanks for looking, and Happy Shopping!!!!

***Overseas Customers***

I have added what I *think* the postage will come to. If it is too much, I will refund you the difference, if it isn't enough, you have got a bargain ;)

name: Aquatic, Perfection Lace
description:
Dip~dyed by me, in my Studio, using acid dyes :)

'Perfection' is made up of six plies (or 'ends' as they are correctly known in spinner lingo), quite loosely plied... 800 metres of pure and unadulterated LuXuRY . Because it is 'multi~ended, it will also have fantastic stitch definition. I advise you work with a blunt~ish needle, as it would be a shame to split the yarn as you knit/crochet.

Absolutely perfect for Shawls, in fact all Lace projects, and not at all scary :-) The drape on it will be amazing!

100%Pure Mulberry Silk

**Handwash Only!!**

875 yds /800 m, per 100g skein

Suggested Needle size: varies according to effect wanted

If you need any more information about this Yarrrn.....just send me a message!

description:

To quote the artist herself:

Why not treat yourself to a matching DPN roll as well, then you'll be the talk of your knitting group ;)
